anti_affinity.Description: Enable anti affinity groups for nodes in the pool

available_nodes.Description: Number of nodes which are actually ready in the pool

current_nodes.Description: Number of nodes present in the pool

desired_nodes.Description: Number of nodes you desire in the pool

max_nodes.Description: Number of nodes you desire in the pool

min_nodes.Description: Number of nodes you desire in the pool

monthly_billed.Description: Enable monthly billing on all nodes in the pool

service_name.Description: Service name

size_status.Description: Status describing the state between number of nodes wanted and available ones

up_to_date_nodes.Description: Number of nodes with latest version installed in the pool

pattern_section.Description: The list of customs Grok patterns

is_restart_required.Description: Indicate if input need to be restarted

status.Description: init: configuration required, pending: ready to start, running: available

can_alert.Description: Indicates if the current user can create alert on the stream

cold_storage_notify_enabled.Description: Notify on new Cold storage archive

indexing_notify_enabled.Description: If set, notify when size is near 80, 90 or 100 % of the maximum configured setting

is_editable.Description: Indicates if you are allowed to edit entry

is_shareable.Description: Indicates if you are allowed to share entry

pause_indexing_on_max_size.Description: If set, pause indexing when maximum size is reach

service_name.Description: The service name

bootid_on_destroy.Description: If set, reboot the server on the specified boot id during destroy phase

custom_hostname.Description: Set up the server using the provided hostname instead of the default hostname

post_installation_script_link.Description: Indicate the URL where your postinstall customisation script is located

post_installation_script_return.Description: indicate the string returned by your postinstall customisation script on successful execution. Advice: your script should return a unique validation string in case of succes. A good example is 'loh1Xee7eo OK OK OK UGh8Ang1Gu'

ssh_key_name.Description: Name of the ssh key that should be installed. Password login will be disabled

use_distrib_kernel.Description: Use the distribution's native kernel instead of the recommended OVH Kernel

service_name.Description: The internal name of your dedicated server.

keepers.Description: Change this value to recreate a reboot task.

boot_id.Description: The boot id of your dedicated server.

dnssec_supported.Description: Is DNSSEC supported by this zone

has_dns_anycast.Description: hasDnsAnycast flag of the DNS zone

last_update.Description: Last update date of the DNS zone

name_servers.Description: Name servers that host the DNS zone

ipv4.Description: The IPV4 associated to your IP load balancing

ipv6.Description: The IPV6 associated to your IP load balancing. DEPRECATED.

metrics_token.Description: The metrics token associated with your IP load balancing

offer.Description: The offer of your IP load balancing

orderable_zone.Description: Available additional zone for your Load Balancer

plan_code.Description: The billing planCode for this zone

value.Description: Path to the resource in API.OVH.COM

value.Description: Path to the resource in API.OVH.COM

service_name.Description: The internal name of your IP load balancing

ssl_configuration.Description: Modern oldest compatible clients : Firefox 27, Chrome 30, IE 11 on Windows 7, Edge, Opera 17, Safari 9, Android 5.0, and Java 8. Intermediate oldest compatible clients : Firefox 1, Chrome 1, IE 7, Opera 5, Safari 1, Windows XP IE8, Android 2.3, Java 7. Intermediate if null.

vrack_name.Description: Name of the vRack on which the current Load Balancer is attached to, as it is named on vRack product

action.Description: Action triggered when all rules match

status.Description: HTTP status code for "redirect" and "reject" actions

target.Description: Farm ID for "farm" action type or URL template for "redirect" action. You may use ${uri}, ${protocol}, ${host}, ${port} and ${path} variables in redirect target

type.Description: Action to trigger if all the rules of this route matches

display_name.Description: Human readable name for your route, this field is for you

rules.Description: List of rules to match to trigger action

field.Description: Name of the field to match like "protocol" or "host". See "/ipLoadbalancing/{serviceName}/route/availableRules" for a list of available rules

match.Description: Matching operator. Not all operators are available for all fields. See "/availableRules"

pattern.Description: Value to match against this match. Interpretation if this field depends on the match and field

sub_field.Description: Name of sub-field, if applicable. This may be a Cookie or Header name for instance

service_name.Description: The internal name of your IP load balancing

status.Description: Route status. Routes in "ok" state are ready to operate

weight.Description: Route priority ([0..255]). 0 if null. Highest priority routes are evaluated last. Only the first matching route will trigger an action

action.Description: Action triggered when all rules match

target.Description: Farm ID for "farm" action type, empty for others

type.Description: Action to trigger if all the rules of this route matches

display_name.Description: Human readable name for your route, this field is for you

rules.Description: List of rules to match to trigger action

service_name.Description: The internal name of your IP load balancing

status.Description: Route status. Routes in "ok" state are ready to operate

weight.Description: Route priority ([0..255]). 0 if null. Highest priority routes are evaluated last. Only the first matching route will trigger an action

display_name.Description: Human readable name for your vrack network

farm_id.Description: This attribute is there for documentation purpose only and isnt passed to the OVH API as it may conflicts with http/tcp farms `vrack_network_id` attribute

nat_ip.Description: An IP block used as a pool of IPs by this Load Balancer to connect to the servers in this private network. The blck must be in the private network and reserved for the Load Balancer

service_name.Description: The internal name of your IPloadbalancer

subnet.Description: IP block of the private network in the vRack

vlan.Description: VLAN of the private network in the vRack. 0 if the private network is not in a VLAN

vrack_network_id.Description: Internal Load Balancer identifier of the vRack private network

password_last_update.Description: When the user changed his password for the last time

available_languages.Description: List of all language available for this template

base_template_name.Description: OVH template name yours will be based on, choose one among the list given by compatibleTemplates function

beta.Description: This distribution is new and, although tested and functional, may still display odd behaviour

category.Description: Category of this template (informative only). (basic, customer, hosting, other, readyToUse, virtualisation)

custom_hostname.Description: Set up the server using the provided hostname instead of the default hostname

post_installation_script_link.Description: Indicate the URL where your postinstall customisation script is located

post_installation_script_return.Description: indicate the string returned by your postinstall customisation script on successful execution. Advice: your script should return a unique validation string in case of succes. A good example is 'loh1Xee7eo OK OK OK UGh8Ang1Gu'

ssh_key_name.Description: Name of the ssh key that should be installed. Password login will be disabled

use_distribution_kernel.Description: Use the distribution's native kernel instead of the recommended OVH Kernel

default_language.Description: The default language of this template

distribution.Description: the distribution this template is based on

hard_raid_configuration.Description: This distribution supports hardware raid configuration through the OVH API

last_modification.Description: Date of last modification of the base image

lvm_ready.Description: This distribution supports Logical Volumes (Linux LVM)

remove_default_partition_schemes.Description: Remove default partition schemes at creation

supports_distribution_kernel.Description: This distribution supports installation using the distribution's native kernel instead of the recommended OVH kernel

supports_gpt_label.Description: This distribution supports the GUID Partition Table (GPT), providing up to 128 partitions that can have more than 2TB

supports_sql_server.Description: This distribution supports the microsoft SQL server

priority.Description: on a reinstall, if a partitioning scheme is not specified, the one with the higher priority will be used by default, among all the compatible partitioning schemes (given the underlying hardware specifications)

disks.Description: Disk List. Syntax is cX:dY for disks and [cX:dY,cX:dY] for groups. With X and Y resp. the controller id and the disk id

mode.Description: RAID mode (raid0, raid1, raid10, raid5, raid50, raid6, raid60)

step.Description: Specifies the creation order of the hardware RAID

order.Description: step or order. specifies the creation order of the partition on the disk

size.Description: size of partition in MB, 0 => rest of the space

volume_name.Description: The volume name needed for proxmox distribution

description.Description: For documentation purpose only. This attribute is not passed to the OVH API as it cannot be retrieved back. Instead a fake description ('$name auto description') is passed at creation time.

default.Description: True when this public Ssh key is used for rescue mode and reinstallations

key_name.Description: Name of this public Ssh key
